mainEntity.name: What elementary schools serve Skye Canyon Las Vegas?

acceptedAnswer.text: Skye Canyon is served by three excellent K-5 elementary schools: William & Mary Scherkenbach Elementary School, James Bilbray Elementary School, and Kenneth Divich Elementary, all part of Clark County School District.

mainEntity.name: Which middle schools do Skye Canyon students attend?

acceptedAnswer.text: Skye Canyon students attend Ralph Cadwallader Middle School or Edmundo Escobedo Sr Middle School, both highly-rated Clark County School District middle schools serving the northwest Las Vegas area.

mainEntity.name: What is the zoned high school for Skye Canyon Nevada?

acceptedAnswer.text: Arbor View High School is the zoned high school for Skye Canyon residents, known for excellent academics, athletics programs, and college preparation courses in Las Vegas Nevada.

mainEntity.name: Are there charter school options in Skye Canyon?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Somerset Academy Skye Canyon Campus offers K-12 charter education with smaller class sizes, specialized programs, and innovative teaching methods for Skye Canyon families.

mainEntity.name: Will Skye Canyon get its own schools?

acceptedAnswer.text: Future development plans include a K-5 elementary school, middle school, and high school within Skye Canyon community, subject to Clark County School District funding and enrollment projections.

mainEntity.name: How do I find school zoning for my Skye Canyon address?

acceptedAnswer.text: Visit Clark County School District website for elementary, middle, and high school zoning maps, or contact Dr. Jan Duffy at (702) 500-1902 for assistance with school information for specific Skye Canyon properties.
